front.title: On the difficulty of Quantum Cryptography in presence of packet losses

abstract.t: In the communication viewpoint, quantum state, i.e., qubit is different from classical bit. Qubit may be transmitted directly but it can’t be cloned or measured without altercation, so existing copy and resend scheme can’t be used to handle a transmission failure. Moreover, in some cases, a sender, even none, knows the state of qubit, so qubit loss may cause irrevocable damage. This draft presents the causes of transmission failures and, analyses the vulnerabilities of several crypto protocols, such defects may bring forth. Thus, quantum teleportation is highly recommended for certain applications.
